answerText: eigenvalues [or characteristic values; or latent roots; or proper values; prompt on "lambda"][10] Eigenvalues are defined for a square one of these entities. These things, which can be thought of as a bunch of column vectors in a row, are the basic object of study of linear algebra.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Illinois A - VCU A | 19 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The spectral theorem gives a decomposition that puts these numbers on the diagonals. For 10 points each: [10] Name these values. Their sum is equal to the trace, and their product gives the determinant.
